stages.title: Repository

items.help_tip: Select a target repository
items.label: Target Repository

option_values.description: CG compliant data object description template - this is a placeholder text
option_values.label: CG Core

option_values.description: This repository option defines metadata for submission of raw sequence reads to the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA)
option_values.label: ENA - Sequence Reads

option_values.description: This repository option defines metadata for submission of sequence assemblies to the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA)
option_values.label: ENA - Sequence Assemblies

option_values.description: This repository option defines metadata for submission of sequence annotations to the European Nucleotide Archive (ENA)
option_values.label: ENA - Sequence Annotations

option_values.description: Figshare accepts many file formats, and can be used to submit file types including PDFs, image, audio, and video files
option_values.label: Figshare

option_values.description: MIAPPE is a Minimum Information (MI) standard for plant phenotyping. This repository option defines a list of attributes for describing a phenotyping experiment
option_values.label: MIAPPE Compliant

option_values.description: Dublin Core is a generic community stardard metadata set for describing digital objects (such as images, video, pdfs, webpages) and physical objects (such as books or CDs). Items described with this schema can be submitted to Dataverse or dSpace instances
option_values.label: Dublin Core

stages.message: Select the target repository for which this description is intended. The target repository choice helps inform the wizard on an appropriate metadata template for your description.

items.help_tip: Select a type for your information product
items.label: Type
option_values: Dataset As A Collection Of Data

stages.title: Subtype

items.help_tip: Select a subtype for your information product type
items.label: Subtype

stages.message: You can (optionally) refine your type with a subtype. In such case, the metadata requirements of the subtype will apply. What is called subtype can have the character of an attribute such as internal, template or interactive, which tells the user more about the kind of usage.

items.help_tip: Please type the title of the information product.
items.label: Title

items.help_tip: Please specify if the document is peer-reviewed or not.
items.label: Peer-reviewed

items.help_tip: Please describe in few words the content of the information product and where necessary the methodology applied.
items.label: Description

items.help_tip: Please add keywords describing the subject of the information product.
items.label: Subject

items.help_tip: Please add the edition name if applicable.
items.label: Edition

stages.title: Stage - 3
stages.message: Dynamically generated stage - still needs appropriate message!

items.help_tip: Please give the name and check the correct spelling.
items.label: Creator

items.help_tip: Please give an ORCID identifier of that creator.
items.label: Creator Id

items.help_tip: Please add some rights information about the information product.
items.label: Rights

items.help_tip: Please note the organization the creator was affiliated with at time of creation.

option_values.label: International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA)
option_values.value: International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA)

option_values.label: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)
option_values.value: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)

option_values.label: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT)
option_values.value: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT)

items.label: Creator affiliation

items.help_tip: Please describe the temporal and spatial coverage.
items.label: coverage

items.help_tip: Please pick the license.
items.label: License

items.help_tip: Please add the official copyright holder.
items.label: Copyright holder

items.help_tip: If there are terms of use other or beyond the license terms, please specify them here. (Examples: "non-commercial educational use only", or "Re-use (no translations)" )
items.label: Terms of use

items.help_tip: If there are any rights specifications that goes beyond the license and the terms of use, please specify them here in freetext. (Examples: "copyright - all rights reserved" (if no license applies), or you may need to give a permission statement with an e-mail of the permitting body)
items.label: Rights statement

items.help_tip: Here, you can describe relations to other information products. This helps finding and re-using content and hence increases the citation rate.
items.label: Relation

items.help_tip: Please add Agrovoc keywords describing the subject of the information product.
items.label: Agrovoc subject

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of any relevant service provider.
items.label: Service Provider(s)

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the geoinformation specialist involved in producing the information product.
items.label: Geoinformation Specialist(s) involved

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the translator(s) if applicable.
items.label: Translator(s)

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of any other relevant contributor.
items.label: Other contributors

items.help_tip: Please add the name of the event.
items.label: Event name

items.help_tip: Please pick the best fitting event type.
items.label: Event type

items.help_tip: Please pick the start date of the event.
items.label: Event start date

items.help_tip: Please pick one or more international regions the information product relates to.
items.label: supernational region

items.help_tip: Please pick one or more countries the information product relates to.
items.label: Country

items.help_tip: Please pick one or more national administrative units the information product relates to.
items.label: Administrative Unit

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the supervisor(s).
items.label: Supervisor(s)

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the data analyst(s).
items.label: Data Analyst(s)

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the project leader.
items.label: Project Leader

items.help_tip: Please pick one or more agro-ecological zones the information product is valid for.
items.label: Agro-Ecological Zone (FAO)

items.help_tip: Please add the publisher. Usually a commercial publisher (like "Elsevier") or the institute of the main creator (like "IFPRI").
items.label: Publisher

items.help_tip: If the information product as other related information products with the same content but different format, those can be specified by name or identifier.
items.label: has format

items.help_tip: If the information product is in a different format of an original, the original one can be specified here by name or identifier.
items.label: is Format of

items.help_tip: If the information product is part of a larger whole, specify this container name or even better give the identifier.
items.label: has Part

items.help_tip: If the information product contains part, you can specify this parts names or even better give the identifiers.
items.label: is Part of

items.help_tip: If the information product is version of another information product, specify this other information product name or even better give the link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: has Version

items.help_tip: If the information product contains part, you can specify this parts names or even better give the identifying handle or DOI.
items.label: is Version of

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the producer(s).
items.label: Producer(s)

items.help_tip: If the information product conforms to a certain information product such as a standard, please specify this information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: conforms to

items.help_tip: If this information product is referenced by another information product, please specify the referenced information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: is referenced by

items.help_tip: If this information product requires another information product, please specify the required information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: requires

items.help_tip: If this information product is required by another information product, please specify that information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: is required by

items.help_tip: If this information product is containing the metadata for another information product, please specify that described information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: is metadata for

items.help_tip: If this information product uses another information product to store its metadata, please specify that information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: has metadata for

items.help_tip: Please add the editor name or identifier.
items.label: Editor(s)

items.help_tip: Please add the name or identifier of the hosting institute of the activity described.
items.label: Hosting Institution(s)

items.help_tip: If this information product references another information product, please specify the referenced information product name or even better give the identifying link in form of a handle or DOI.
items.label: references

items.help_tip: Please describe the chronological validity
items.label: Chronological validity

stages.title: Stage - 4
stages.message: Dynamically generated stage - still needs appropriate message!

items.help_tip: Please add the contact point for this information product. Tip: use a department rather than an individual; this field is intended to provide a point of contact for anyone who has questions or needs further guidance about the dataset or information product connected to the record.
items.label: Contact point

items.help_tip: Please add the E-Mail address of the chosen contact point.
items.label: Contact email

items.help_tip: Please pick the date of creation. This day marks the start of the embargo period.
items.label: Creation date

items.help_tip: Please pick the end date of the embargo period according to the applicable data sharing policy.
items.label: Embargo End Date

items.help_tip: Please add the Project name which is responsible for the creation of the information product.
items.label: Project

items.help_tip: Please pick from the list the name of the donor of the project.
items.label: Donor

items.help_tip: Please add the Project Lead Center of the CRP (if applicable).

option_values.label: International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA)
option_values.value: International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA)

option_values.label: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)
option_values.value: International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)

option_values.label: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT)
option_values.value: International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT)

items.label: Project Lead Center

items.help_tip: Please add the name of Partner (either organization or name). Whenever possible, use official identifier like ORCID numbers for a person or ISNI for an organization.
items.label: Partner Institute in the Project

items.help_tip: Please pick from the list the CRP name under which the information product was created.
items.label: CGIAR Research Program

items.help_tip: Please give the latitude coordinate of the geospatial point(s).
items.label: Latitude (DD)

items.help_tip: Please give the longitudinal coordinate of the geospatial point(s).
items.label: Longitude (DD)

stages.title: Stage - 5
stages.message: Dynamically generated stage - still needs appropriate message!

items.help_tip: Please pick the file type.
items.label: File format

items.help_tip: Please pick from the list the acronyms of the language contained in the information product (Default="English"). Use "Artificial languages" in case of a programming language and "No linguistic content" for an information product without linguistic content. Select "Uncoded languages" for languages without an ISO code.
items.label: Language

items.help_tip: Please add an identifier of this information product. This may be a handle, DOI, ISSN, ISBN or the like.
items.label: Identifier

items.help_tip: Please add the type of identifier
items.label: Type of identifier

items.help_tip: Please write the text that you want the user to cite this document.
items.label: Citation text

items.help_tip: Please add the original journal or other type of material where an item was originally published, for example a journal title if the information product described is a journal article.
items.label: Source document

items.help_tip: Here you can give any more citation relevant details how the item was published.
items.label: How publish

items.help_tip: Please add the number of the periodical or series.
items.label: Number

items.help_tip: You may want to add any notes to the information product citation.
items.label: Notes

stages.title: Stage - 6
stages.message: Dynamically generated stage - still needs appropriate message!

stages.title: Datafile Attributes
stages.message:
In this stage each attribute value that describes a datafile is represented in a column, allowing specific attribute values for individual datafiles to be easily accessed and modified. You can also batch-update attribute values for groups of datafiles.
  • To update attribute value for a single datafile:
    1. Click to focus on a cell (note: this action is different from row selection)
    2. Double-click or press 'Enter' on a focused cell to make it editable
    3. Make your changes and double-click or press 'Enter' again to save your changes
  • To batch-update corresponding attribute values for a group of datafiles:
    1. Click to focus on a target cell, the value of which will be used to update corresponding cells of selected records
    2. Select one or more rows that will form the update batch
    3. Click the 'Update selected records' button
  • Click Next, when done editing, to proceed to the final stage
